name: TU Campus Inquiry Project
description: I developed a web application built using the MEAN stack, Bootstrap, and Nodemailer that enables students to submit inquiries/requests regarding Towson University campuses and connect with counselors.

name: Murder Mystery Project
description: I developed a text-based storyline interactive game in Java that focuses on a murder mystery where the player explores a crime scene, finds evidence, investigates clues, and reaches a conclusion. This is the project's second revision, where I refactored the code to include fundamental object-oriented programming principles such as Abstraction, Encapsulation, Inheritance, and Polymorphism.

name: Nonlinear ODEs and PDEs Equivalence Project
description: This was a group research project for my Ordinary Differential Equations class that focuses on the transformations and equivalence of nonlinear ODEs and linear PDEs in the context of Fluid Dynamics. I independently created a LaTeX file to provide an alternative format for our presentation.
